name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Salt Lake City

reviews.text: Not much outside charm but this hotel is well located and easy to get to and from. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are huge. The pool is small but very nice. I had an OUTSTANDING room service dinner at a reasonable price and the included breakfast was great.
reviews.title: Everything is easy!

reviews.text: Stay at Double Tree in Salt Lake City, UT was nice and able to travel quickly to meeting. A couple restaurants are within walking distance to add to experience. Buffett breakfast was typical with meat, eggs, pancakes & cereal.
reviews.title: Good stay in SLC

reviews.text: I traveled with two other people. Each one of us had our own rooms. We booked the hotel on line. Told the person we are Goverment employees. He gave us the Goverment rate. When we checked into the hotel we were told that they could not give us the Gloverment rate. We all had our ID'S to prove this but the staff at the hotel including the manager denied our quoted rates. We were stuck because all other hotels in the area were booked. Our finance department is tossing around not letting us stay at a Hilton Hotel. My co-worker and myself went down to the front desk to get more coffee pods. The desk clerk took our information. I recieved the coffe an hour and half later. My co-worker never received her requested coffee. I was unable to conduct business using your internet. I had to use my cell phone as a hotspot. The internet was not strong enough for the business that I needed to take care of. I only had 2 bars on my computer with your internet. I did not feel safe in the hotel one time the second floor outside door I found to be wide open. I closed it and when I returned the door was open again. Anyone could have walked into the hotel even through the front door.
reviews.title: Price Issues

reviews.text: All with the hotel is very good - rooms, parking, condition of furnishings, food. Problem is that in my room there was no internet or heat during some very cool nights, only cold air. Staff offered to try and remedy problems, but were unable to get it resolved. Workout facility acceptable, but small for this size of hotel. Had to wait for availability of equipment.
reviews.title: Hotel Good, But Experienced Problems

reviews.text: I travel regularly to SLC for work, and this is my hotel of choice. There is a TRAX (light rail) station about a block from the hotel, and it's easy to walk around the city. The hotel offers a free shuttle to/from the airport (just need to book in advance, every hour leaving the hotel during certain hours.) The breakfast buffet is quite extensive. The rooms are huge. I believe this is an old Embassy Suites. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful. And room service is CHEAP!
reviews.title: Great choice in downtown SLC

reviews.text: Exceptionally large rooms that are quite comfortable. I enjoyed the included breakfast bar and wifi. I would definitely stay here again. The front desk can provide a walking map of downtown Salt Lake. The TRAX train is within walking distance but look up the directions in advance.
reviews.title: Great space for the money!

reviews.text: Fresh air, not processed air is really desirable. This means outside air which the guest can control. A window or direct outside air intake is the preferred method. There are no operating windows in the rooms of this hotel.
reviews.title: A very dry invironment

reviews.text: The reception for ESPN Monday Night Football kept cutting in and out. The management did not want to be bothered to either fix the problem or relocate me to another room. I missed the game. When I tried to discuss it with the manager upon check out, he refused to leave his office and instead had the clerk offer me 10,000 HiltonHonors points. Extememlt unprofessional.
reviews.title: No Monday Night Football

reviews.text: Great place to stay if you're in this city. Parking is free, even for this downtown hotel. Plenty of parking, though there are no elevators in the parking structure if you end up parking in the higher floors.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The hotel seems to have been recently renovated. Everything is very modern looking and does not look worn out. The only comment I can make regarding the update to the hotel is that they did not remove the popcorn ceiling texture. Other than that, the renovations look great.
reviews.title: Refreshed and renovated hotel

reviews.text: We enjoyed a week at the Doubletree. We loved having the living area separate from the sleeping area as well as the microwave and refrigerator. The staff was very friendly and always willing to accommodate our needs. The shuttle picked us upon our arrival at the airport. We also used the shuttle to take us to City Center shopping, Target, Pioneer Park, Temple Square and to the rehearsal for the Mormon Tabernacle Choir.
reviews.title: Quiet hotel,

reviews.text: The hot chocolate cookies were great also.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.text: The hotel has a restaurant and a business center. I used room service twice and was quite satisfied. The food was tasty and was plentiful.
reviews.title: Pure comfort

reviews.text: Stayed for our annual National Conference with Jamberry Nails. All the staff was very helpful and always smiling. The warm cookies were awesome. We had a private luncheon and the food was out of this world. All in all it was an excellent place to have our conference! Thank you!!!
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is by far the best Doubletree we have stayed in. It is beautiful inside with open spaces and large rooms. The breakfast is wonderful. We would definitely stay here again! My only complaint is that it isn't in the center of things but parking is cheap so this is really minor.
reviews.title: Doubletree Salt Lake City
Spacious, clean rooms - good location
reviews.text: I picked this hotel quite at random while coming to SLC for the first time. (Well, not completely at random since I knew I was going to stay in the Hilton family, if possible.) The Hilton proper is downtown (maybe 6 blocks from the DoubleTree) and might be more convenient if you don't want to walk and are focused on downtown activities. But, it also has all the hassles of a larger property -- separate parking, larger property to walk through, etc. The DoubleTree is a very nice size -- large enough to be anonymous, but small enough so that everything is convenient located.

The suite is ginormous. For realz - very spacious, which was great for me as I was using it as a home base for multi-city meetings in the area. The rooms are also very quiet, which is also lovely. Cleanliness standards are high. And, the room amenities (micro, fridge, and small bar sink in the public area) are all nice touches. Even the way the bathroom is layed out is really super convenient and I may steal ideas for my own house remodel.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Free business center. Apparently, free breakfast (which I only learned tonight after reading some of the other reviews -- so, tip to the staff checking us in -- maybe make that point more clear).
reviews.title: Great value, convenient location

reviews.text: As others sad, the internet connection is maddening. You get kicked off constantly and forget streaming anything. It's quite ridiculous; I stayed on my 3G plan instead in order to just check email.
reviews.title: Quality at a Great Value

reviews.text: I loved the separate bedroom from the living room, having a small fridge, microwave and a complete living room with a couch that opened into a bed if we had needed it. (we were with a group) Cleanliness was top notch and there were a lot of restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: Begin your stay at the DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Salt Lake City with a warm welcome, at this inviting hotel. We will even greet you with our delicious chocolate chip cookie upon arrival. Ideally located in Downtown Salt Lake City, Utah, our full-service hotel is only seven miles from Salt Lake City International Airport (SLC) and nearby many Salt Lake City attractions. Visit the Historic Temple Square or wander around the fascinating Family History Library. We are also situated nearby a Salt Lake City TRAX Station, providing easy transportation to many attractions.Choose from a delightful range of suites within this Salt Lake City hotel. Each of our stylish suites feature modern décor and are rich in comforts. Enjoy modern amenities such as LCD TVs and wireless internet access. Stay active and work out in the fitness center or swim laps in the heated indoor swimming pool.Choose from tempting menu creations in the hotels inviting on-site dining venue, The Plum Restaurant. Enjoy freshly prepared favorites ranging from colorful salads to tasty steak and chips. The hotel bar also offers a relaxing spot to unwind at the end of a busy day.Host an important meeting or special event at this downtown Salt Lake City hotel with a range of flexible meeting rooms. With 6,000sq.ft of flexible meeting and banquet space, including the latest AV equipment, our professional staff can organize any event. Corporate guests will also appreciate our 24-hour business center with wireless internet, printing and photocopying services.
